topic_seeds.description: Persistent worry about various life aspects (relatively straightforward)
Questioning identity or sense of self (complex, layered situation)

flaw_patterns.name: intellectualizing
flaw_patterns.description: Analyzes feelings instead of feeling them, uses distance

flaw_patterns.name: forgetting_prior_insight
flaw_patterns.description: Returns to old pattern despite earlier realization

exchanges.user:
So I'm not even sure where to start with this. Work has been a mess lately, and I keep telling myself it's probably nothing to worry about but honestly I don't know anymore. There's been talk about restructuring in my department, and while nobody's explicitly said anything to me personally, I hear things. The uncertainty is what gets to me, I think. It's hard to focus when you're constantly wondering if you're going to be on the chopping block, you know?

Beyond that, I've just been feeling kind of stuck generally. Not in a crisis way, but like I'm going through the motions. I work, I come home, I try to sleep. There's this nagging feeling that I should be doing something more with my life but I'm not sure what that even means anymore. Sometimes I wonder if I'm just getting older and losing that drive I used to have, or if something else is going on. Hard to say.

My mom called last week and asked how things were going. I told her everything was fine, which is what I always say. But after I hung up I felt kind of empty about it. Like I'm not really letting anyone in, including myself, if that makes sense. Anyway, I'm here because at least talking about it might help clarify things.

There's this guilt thing happening too—like I should feel relieved or grateful but mostly I just feel hollow about the whole thing. The anxiety didn't really go away, it just shifted into something else.

That's pretty much it. I don't have a hobby or anything I'm passionate about anymore. I used to run, actually. Did that pretty seriously in my 30s. Somewhere along the way I just stopped. Kept telling myself I was too busy or too tired and eventually it just became my life to not do it. Which is weird to say out loud because when I hear myself say that it sounds like I'm being passive about something I could actually control, but... I don't know. It feels bigger than just deciding to run again.
